oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ray Wylie Hubbard Live at the Lone Star Cafe -- 1978-08-21
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is from the Lonestar Cafe live show. The tape features a live performance of Ray Wylie Hubbard (musician). The Lonestar Cafe show is presented by Mort Cooperman, Bill McGivney and the WHN radio network. The recording of Ray Wylie Hubbard is from August 22, 1978.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ray Wylie Hubbard
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Incoherent background discussion -- (02:45) Ray Wylie Hubbard tunes up on top of incoherent background discussion -- (05:12) An unidentified female host introduces Hubbard for his WHN performance -- (06:00) I Did Love You [unconfirmed] (Ray Wylie Hubbard) -- (08:24) Hubbard greets the crowd -- (09:03) Mr. Bojangles [unconfirmed] (Ray Wylie Hubbard) -- (14:10) Hubbard jokes about Jerry Walker's ability to make others seem sober -- (15:09) Love Another Game (Ray Wylie Hubbard) -- (19:19) Hubbard jokes about repeating himself and introduces the band -- (20:25) What a Way to Go (Ray Wylie Hubbard) -- (25:41) London Homesick Blues (Home With the Armadillo) (Ray Wylie Hubbard) -- (29:41) He's the One (Who Made Me Number Two) (Ray Wylie Hubbard) -- (32:45) $60 Ford (Ray Wylie Hubbard) -- (35:44) West Texas Country Western Dance Band (Ray Wylie Hubbard) -- (39:53) Hubbard jokes about his guitar 'breaking down' -- (40:51) Blackeyed Peas (Ray Wylie Hubbard) -- (44:34) Redneck Mother (Ray Wylie Hubbard) -- (50:03) Hubbard jokes about doing an encore out of sympathy -- (50:37) Fort Worth [unconfirmed] (Ray Wylie Hubbard) -- (53:03) Chet [unconfirmed] (Ray Wylie Hubbard) -- (56:30) Redneck Mother (Ray Wylie Hubbard) -- (58:48) The unidentified female host praises Hubbard and performs her outro statements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hubbard, Ray Wylie;
